Package org.fluentjdbc

Interface DbContextListableSelect<T extends DbContextListableSelect<T>>

  • All Superinterfaces:
    DatabaseQueryable<T>
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    DbContextJoinedSelectBuilder, DbContextSelectBuilder
    public interface DbContextListableSelect<T extends DbContextListableSelect<T>>
extends DatabaseQueryable<T>
    Interface to execute terminal operations for SELECT-statements. Usage: 
     try (DbContextConnection ignored = context.startConnection(dataSource)) {
     table.where...().list(row -> row.getUUID("column"));
     table.where...().single(row -> row.getLocalDate("column"));
 }

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Default Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method Description
      void forEach​(DatabaseResult.RowConsumer row)
      Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row
      int getCount()
      Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result
      <OBJECT> List<OBJECT> list​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> object)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list.
      default List<Long> listLongs​(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list
      default List<String> listStrings​(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list
      default Optional<Instant> singleInstant​(String fieldName)
      Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query.
      default Optional<Number> singleLong​(String fieldName)
      Returns a long from the specified column name
      <OBJECT> Optional<OBJECT> singleObject​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      If the query returns no rows, returns Optional.empty(), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
      default Optional<String> singleString​(String fieldName)
      Returns a string from the specified column name
      <OBJECT> Stream<OBJECT> stream​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
      Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream.

      • Methods inherited from interface org.fluentjdbc.DatabaseQueryable

        query, where, whereAll, whereExpression, whereExpression, whereExpressionWithMultipleParameters, whereIn, whereOptional

    • Method Detail

      • stream

        <OBJECT> Stream<OBJECT> stream​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
        Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a stream. Example: 
             table.where("status", status).stream(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

      • list

        <OBJECT> List<OBJECT> list​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> object)
        Execute the query and map each return value over the DatabaseResult.RowMapper function to return a list. Example: 
             List<Instant> creationTimes = table.where("status", status).list(row -> row.getInstant("created_at"))

      • getCount

        int getCount()
        Executes SELECT count(*) FROM ... on the query and returns the result

      • listStrings

        default List<String> listStrings​(String fieldName)
        Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list

      • listLongs

        default List<Long> listLongs​(String fieldName)
        Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query and returns the result as a list

      • singleObject

        @Nonnull
<OBJECT> Optional<OBJECT> singleObject​(DatabaseResult.RowMapper<OBJECT> mapper)
        If the query returns no rows, returns Optional.empty(), if exactly one row is returned, maps it and return it, if more than one is returned, throws `IllegalStateException`
        Parameters:
        mapper - Function object to map a single returned row to a object
        Returns:
        the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

      • singleString

        @Nonnull
default Optional<String> singleString​(String fieldName)
        Returns a string from the specified column name
        Returns:
        the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

      • singleLong

        @Nonnull
default Optional<Number> singleLong​(String fieldName)
        Returns a long from the specified column name
        Returns:
        the mapped row if one row is returned, Optional.empty otherwise
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if more than one row was matched the the query

      • singleInstant

        @Nonnull
default Optional<Instant> singleInstant​(String fieldName)
        Executes SELECT fieldName FROM ... on the query. If there is no rows, returns Optional.empty(), if there is one result, returns it, if there are more than one result, throws IllegalStateException

      • forEach

        void forEach​(DatabaseResult.RowConsumer row)
        Executes the SELECT * FROM ... statement and calls back to DatabaseResult.RowConsumer for each returned row
